data.title: NYS Parks, Recreation & Historic Preservation
data.meta_description: Information on qualifications, exam, selection process, salary and benefits.
data.text:
Join Our Team

Your browser does not support iFrames.

If you want a rewarding career in law enforcement with an emphasis on helping people and protecting the state's natural and historic treasures, consider becoming a New York State Park Police Officer. Our team works in some of the most beautiful places in the state. Contact a Park Police Recruiter in your area.

The Hiring Process Salary & Benefits Contact Us

Become a Park Police Officer

Civil Service Exam Date September 28, 2024

Exam Application Period July 12, 2024-August 14, 2024

Go to https://www.cs.ny.gov/examannouncements/types/oc/

Stay updated by subscribing for notifications:

NYS PARKS

https://public.govdelivery.com/accounts/NYPARKS/subscriber/new

Civil Service

https://public.govdelivery.com/accounts/NYCS/subscriber/new?topic_id=NYCS_4

The Hiring Process

If you have additional questions, please review the Hiring Process Frequently Asked Questions (pdf) and call or email with any additional questions.

To learn more about the Park Police Academy and working as a Park Police Officer, click here: Academy and Job Scope Frequently Asked Questions (pdf)

For questions regarding employment with the New York State Park Police, please contact the appropriate region or headquarters listed below and ask to speak with the Recruiting Officer.

Long Island - (631) 321-3700 (Nassau, Suffolk)

Hudson Valley - (845) 786-2704 (Palisades, Taconic, NYC)

Mid-State â€“ (315) 492-6422 (Central, Finger Lakes, Thousand Islands, Saratoga/Capital)

Western New York - (716) 278-1777 (Niagara, Genesee, Allegany)

Division Headquarters - Albany - (518) 474-4029
